poem:
Title: "In The Meadows of Learning"

Clement dawn kindles a fire,
In the meadows where youths aspire,
While phrases fly, and signs flash,
Unmasking minds in an unruly clash.
A fervor twines anti-Semitic ire,
Not politics, nor zeal to inspire.
Staunch the flow of bigot's bile,
Where ideas ought to run a mile.
In the halls where wisdom's midwife,
Awake to more than life's strife.
